title.narrative: Humanitarian Negotiations Training in The Hague

description.narrative: Offering tailored negotiation skills training for humanitarian aid workers working both at field level and headquarters. Clingendael training sessions help participants to develop a reliable set of negotiation skills, in order to increase the chance of gaining access to persons in need and population in conflict.
Participants have gained humanitarian negotiation skills and knowledge and are actively implementing this knowledge in their work.

We train: 1. staff of headquarter level and regional office level (strategic level, strengthening institutional capacity) 2. Humanitarian aid workers in the field on operational and frontline level (sharing best practices and lessons learned). 3. Humanitarian mediators, a seperate group, who have the trust of both the warring party and humanitarian actors.
